so you tell us when you're done about the advantages
1. good communication tool
1.1 you can ask questions
1.2 you can give answers
1.3 you can find answers
1.4 unlike chats, the information is well structured (if the admin is smart) and you can store it very well
2. good documentation tool
2.1 everything is stored, and if a company wants to organize an information it can
2.2 available anytime and easy access with a good search engine
3. ease of use
3.1 anyone can add a post on a forum
3.2 anyone can access a forum
4. security
4.1 authentication makes it impossible for someone to write if not accepted but anyone can see
4.2 no one can edit your posts, so what, when and who wrote is clear and visible to everyone
4.3 reliability is obtained through grades added to the users that give relevant information, so that you know whom to trust
THE END

ok
1. blogs can be well organised and therefore provide valuable information to the reader who wants to understand a certain topic
2. the blogger (or the many bloggers blogging on one blog) can add a personal touch to the information provided
3.there can be blogs for everything: for kids/people about their life, orbusiness blogs - sharing information about a company / technology etc.
4. blogs are a good support for providing conclusions and the steps taken in developing a technology
5. one can add tags to posts so that reader can select only the post him/she likes or wants to read
6. users can comment at the end of everry post - it's like having a forum at the end ef every post
7. security is good also: only allowed users cand post on a blog
and the blogger can also decide who to let to comment on his/her p

8. Google uses blogs, and they do it very smart! Company mangagers /important software developers (both people and companies) use blogsalso! - They are a great tool for telling the world about your job /business, about how you solved an issue and the solutions you tried andwht they failed and how you discovered the best solution and so on
